results.name: Matthias Muller
results.biography:
Matthias Muller

1961 born in Bielefeld, Germany, on March 29
1980-87 Studied Arts and German Literature at the Bielefeld University. Exam
1987-91 Studied Arts at the HBK Braunschweig. Master?s degree
1994-97 Guest professor at the Johann Wolfgang Goethe University Frankfurt
1998-99 Guest professor at the Dortmund Fachhochschule

Matthias Muller lives and works as an artist, film- and videomaker and independent curator in Bielefeld, Germany. Muller organized numerous avant-garde film events, such as the ?Found Footage Film Festival? (1996 and ?99) and the first German festival of autobiographical films ?Ich etc.? (1998) and various touring programs. With his own films and videos he has taken part in major film festivals worldwide, such as the festivals of Cannes, Venice, Berlin and Rotterdam. His work has also been featured in several exhibitions like the documenta X and the Manifesta 3 and in museums like the Museum of Modern Art, New York, and the Musee du Louvre, Paris. Many of his films and videos are part of the collections of institutions like the Centre Georges Pompidou, Paris, and the Museu d?Art Contemporani, Barcelona. Muller?s work has been honoured with more than 40 awards worldwide.

results.name: John Gillies
results.biography: Born 1960 in Beaudesert, John Gillies is a video/film maker and musician. He is a graduate of Sydney College of the Arts and the DDIAE and has taught at many universities in Sydney. Video works include; Hymn, Continuous Monument to the Australian Film Industry, I Need You, Vision, She Says, The Grooves Speak, Techno/Dumb/Show, Test and Armada. He has performed and recorded with many varied and diverse musicians including Jon Rose and Kev Carmody and is represented in video collections in Australia and Japan.
